title: Optimal Mechanism in a Dynamic Stochastic Knapsack Environment
abstract: arXiv:2402.14269v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: This study introduces an optimal mechanism in a dynamic stochastic knapsack environment. The model features a single seller who has a fixed quantity of a perfectly divisible item. Impatient buyers with a piece-wise linear utility function arrive randomly and they report the two-dimensional private information: marginal value and demanded quantity. We derive a revenue-maximizing dynamic mechanism in a finite discrete time framework that satisfies incentive compatibility, individual rationality, and feasibility conditions. It is achieved by characterizing buyers' utility and deriving the Bellman equation. Moreover, we propose the essential penalty scheme for incentive compatibility, as well as the allocation and payment policies. Lastly, we propose algorithms to approximate the optimal policy, based on the Monte Carlo simulation-based regression method and reinforcement learning.

translated_title: 动态随机背包环境中的最优机制
translated_abstract: 本研究介绍了在动态随机背包环境中的最优机制。该模型包括一个拥有一定数量完全可分割物品的单个卖方。急躁的买家以分段线性效用函数随机到来，并报告二维私人信息：边际价值和需求量。我们在有限离散时间框架中推导出一个满足激励兼容性、个体合理性和可行性条件的收入最大化动态机制。通过表征买家的效用并得出贝尔曼方程来实现。此外，我们提出了激励兼容性的基本惩罚方案，以及分配和支付政策。最后，我们提出了基于蒙特卡洛模拟回归方法和强化学习的算法来近似最优政策。
tldr: 介绍了在动态随机背包环境中的最优机制，包括收入最大化动态机制的推导和基于蒙特卡洛模拟回归方法和强化学习的算法。
en_tdlr: Introduces an optimal mechanism in a dynamic stochastic knapsack environment, including the derivation of revenue-maximizing dynamic mechanism and algorithms based on Monte Carlo simulation regression method and reinforcement learning.
